titleStmt.title: A brief survey, or, inquiry made into some particular proceedings of the Congregational churches 1. Concerning their sending forth of persons to preach unto the world, with some queries touching the warrantableness thereof. 2. Concerning such as refuse or neglect to compleat their churches with elders, according to Christs institution, but goe on in feeding and governing of them in common, a way of their own. 3. Concerning the inconsistency of their principles with their practice, that account the people of this nation to be the world, idolaters and antichristians, and yet heed them in their worshipping of God.
titleStmt.author: P. B.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: The words "1. Concerning .. worshipping of God" are bracketed together on title page.
Identified on UMI microfilm (Early English books, 1641-1700) reel 1944 as Wing (2nd ed.) B4654 (number cancelled).
Reproduction of the original in the Congretional Library, London.

place.placeName: the Black-spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls
